summary: This FBI 302 form documents an introductory video conference meeting on February 23, 2021, between a witness (referred to by initials) and the case team investigating Jeffrey Epstein. The witness was advised to obtain counsel and made a spontaneous statement about Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the subject of the captioned case. The witness stated she thought he 'went a little crazy'.

persons.name: Amanda Nicole Young
persons.context: Listed as the agent who conducted the interview on February 1, 2021.

persons.name: Byrne Paul Wilson
persons.context: Listed as the agent who drafted the document on February 1, 2021.

events.title: Introductory Video Conference with Witness
events.description: The case team held an introductory video conference meeting with a witness (referred to by initials) to introduce her to the team investigating Jeffrey Epstein. She was advised to obtain counsel.

events.title: FBI Interview Conducted
events.description: Special Agent Amanda Nicole Young conducted an interview related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation in New York, New York.

locations: New York, New York, United States
keyFacts: A witness (referred to by initials) was introduced to the Epstein case team via video conference on February 23, 2021.
The witness was advised to obtain counsel, and when she stated counsel was expensive, she was advised she could obtain court-appointed counsel.
The witness spontaneously stated she had never seen 'them' do anything but thought Jeffrey Epstein 'went a little crazy'.
The document is an FBI 302 form, indicating it is a report of an interview conducted by the FBI.
The interview was conducted by Special Agent Amanda Nicole Young on February 1, 2021, in New York, NY.
